data_maturity_score.evidence: The role requires traditional ETL tools (InfoSphere DataStage, Azure Data Factory, Informatica) and Cognos reporting; no mention of modern stack components, CI/CD, testing, or data governance.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 maps to the "developing" maturity level.

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data‑stack adoption, CI/CD, data‑quality testing, monitoring, governance, or cloud‑native patterns are mentioned.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Responsibilities are limited to BI reporting, Cognos administration, and ETL development; no mention of backend, ML, or DevOps duties.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: IBM consulting projects can have client‑driven deadlines, but the posting does not explicitly call out on‑call or overtime expectations.

role_clarity.evidence: The job description lists specific tools (Cognos, DataStage, etc.) and tasks (reporting, root‑cause analysis, source‑code management).

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, moderate overtime risk, clear responsibilities, but lack of benefits and visa sponsorship raise minor concerns.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: The posting does not state who the role reports to.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title (e.g., Head of Data, Director) is referenced.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about hiring pace or team expansion.

team_composition.evidence: The posting provides no details on team size or composition.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: The role sits within an IBM Consulting Delivery Center and focuses on BI; no mention of embedding within product squads.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No PTO, flexible hours, or on‑call policies are mentioned; typical consulting environments can be deadline‑driven.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: The posting does not reference learning budgets, mentorship, or career ladders.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Use of legacy BI tools and lack of modern engineering practices suggest a modest technical culture.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open‑source contributions, conference speaking, or innovation programs.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: The description does not reference code review, CI/CD, testing, or monitoring.

innovation_signals.evidence: No language about experimentation, R&D time, or adopting new technologies.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No discussion of refactoring, modernization, or tech‑debt reduction.

ai_integration_level.evidence: The posting contains no reference to machine learning, AI, or related tooling.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools are listed among required or nice‑to‑have skills.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No start‑date or urgency language appears in the posting.

competition_level.evidence: No data on applicant volume, easy‑apply, or location scarcity is provided.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a globally established technology company with >100,000 employees.

hiring_velocity.evidence: No indication of aggressive or steady hiring cadence.

team_size_signals.evidence: Team size is not disclosed in the posting.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded company; funding stage is irrelevant.

role_creation_type.evidence: The posting does not state whether this is a new headcount or a backfill.

strength_details: Role is with IBM, a large, stable enterprise offering long‑term job security.
Focused on BI data engineering with clear expectations around Cognos, ETL tools, and cloud platforms.
Requirements are specific and well‑articulated, reducing ambiguity for candidates.
Onsite location in Pune provides a clear geographic expectation.
concern_details: Compensation details (salary, bonuses, equity) are not provided.
Visa sponsorship is not mentioned, implying only local candidates are eligible.
No information about who the role reports to or team hierarchy.
Career progression, mentorship, and learning budgets are absent from the description.
best_fit_details: Mid‑level data engineers (3‑5 years) with strong Cognos and ETL experience.
Candidates comfortable with traditional BI stacks and multi‑cloud environments.
Engineers looking to work within a large, structured consulting organization.
probe_details: Ask for the full compensation package, including base salary, bonus, and any equity.
Clarify whether responsibilities extend beyond BI reporting to other data domains.
Inquire about formal career ladders, promotion criteria, and mentorship programs.
Understand typical work hours, on‑call duties, and any expectations for weekend work.
Confirm who the position reports to and how the data engineering team is organized.
leverage_details: Your 3+ years of Cognos administration and multi‑cloud ETL experience directly align with the core requirements.
Experience with legacy BI environments is valuable for IBM’s consulting clients.
summary.overall_assessment: The role offers a stable position at a reputable enterprise with a clear focus on BI data engineering. Compensation transparency and career development information are lacking, and there is no visa sponsorship. Candidates with the right skill set and local work authorization will find the fit straightforward.
